postContent: ROMY HyPrspace + Follow ER 17,237 followers smo @  4 WARNING: put on your sunglasses !! Our filters couldn't handle everything Terminator had to say. @  Second test campaign starts pretty well for our scaled stage demonstrator, and for this we have to thank the teams who have worked soooo many hours lately.  In just a few months : 5 successful fire tests in 2 separate campaigns, and 2 successful PDR's. That's what we call efficiency, Bravo HyPrTeam you're the best! @  Also, thank you to the SpaceDreamS team for providing their LOXbox system, the "gaz station” of tomorrow's rocket, a high-pressure, high-flow supply of liquid oxygen for ‘our engine.  And last but not least: a huge thank you to DGA - Direction générale de larmement #DGAEssaisdemissiles Gironde site, for welcoming us again on their test bench, and supporting us for this second campaign.  Stay tuned, another one (with better filters) is coming soon! @  #Innovation #Newspace #Engineering

Like “y Somment J Repost “7 send  WHY HyPrspace + Follow 1d-®  HyPrSpace, chapter VI.  On the 23 of may 2019, six years ago, Alexandre Mangeot, Sylvain Bataillard and Vincent Rocher created HyPrSpace.  Like every birthday, we like to dig out old pictures. They proved to be very relevant on how we became what we are now... This serie is from a fire test demonstration from 2018 to the Lisoir brothers of our very first engine: Lily.  At that time, HyPrSpace wasn't even officially created, it was a "nights & week-ends" project, apart from the profesional lives of our co-founders,  Fun fact: for that fire test, we lighted the engine with a long flaming twig... Not sure  this ignition system can be applied to our rocket! Who's willing to try ? @  From 3 employees that couldn't pay themselves, we're now more than 90 people, all remunerated!! And we're so happy to have kept that same energy, passion and fun vibes you can see in these pictures.  Thank you all for making this adventure so thrilling!

WAY HyPrspace + Follow BEES 17.237 followers 4e®  s  It's not everyday that you get to have the signatures of a delegation of the Centre National d'Etudes Spatiales on your 6 meters long hybrid rocket stage.  Last week, its president Lionel Suchet came to visit us with head of space transportation Carine Leveau and deputy director of futur & innovation for space transportation bruno vi  It wasn't just a mere newspace startup visit, more like a plunge into a different vision of space : much simpler, robust and sustainable. It may feel unconventional at first. Yet through the passion driving our team, and the achievements we made so far, it becomes the obvious technical and economical choice.  It was a pleasure introducing our universe to them personaly!  #innov:  n #NewSpace #OrbitalBaguette

® Like © Comment 1% Repost 7 Send  WHY HyPrspace + Follow 3mo+ @  2 shows a day keeps the doctors away! #  Earlier this week, our co-founder Sylvain Bataillard was attending the Paris Space Week for a roundtable on the theme of the transformative contribution of start-ups to  the needs of the armed forces.  This exchange highlighted the growing importance of innovation-driven companies in the defense sector. At HyPrSpace, we're committed to contributing to the technological advancements shaping the future of security and strategic autonomy.  The same day in Toulouse, the communication team was attending the #Journéedelinnovation organized by the Centre National d'Etudes Spatiales. This edition focused on research and technology activities, on the theme of "Space, innovation, exploration”.  Thank you to the organizers of each show! © #Newspace #Innovation #Defense

HyPrSpace + Follow ESS 17,237 followers Amo ©  carr  We were thrilled to be invited for our very first conference at ISAE-SUPAERO, sharing our passion for hybrid rocket propulsion with students! ?  The subject we brought to them was :  Hybrid space propulsion and its applications”.  Even though it isn’t really a new technology, our patented architecure and innovative engine seemed to have piqued their curiosity, as we had a full amphitheatre and a long moment of exchange at the end...  The exciting part was that for a few of us, it was a return to university, but this time as  speakers. An experience they clearly enjoyed just as much as the students in the audience! &  Trés heureux d'avoir tenu notre toute premiare conférence a 'ISAE-SUPAERO, occasion de partager notre passion pour la propulsion hybride avec les étudiants !  9  Le sujet de cette conférence était : « La propulsion spatiale hybride et ses applications  Mame sii  ne s'agit pas vraiment d'une nouvelle technologie, notre architecture brevetée et notre moteur innovant semblent avoir piqué leur curiosité, puisque nous avons eu un amphithéatre plein et un long moment d'échange pour conclure !  Pour certains d'entre nous, c’était un retour & 'université, mais cette fois-ci en tant qu'intervenants. Une expérience quils ont manifestement appréciée tout autant que les étudiants présents dans le public! ©  #Engineers #Innovation #Teaching  Show translation  a cs

+ Follow  Hyer sence  Hey LinkedIn, what's up since last year? €  an  Wishing you all a very happy 2025! May this year be filled with experiments and learning. Try, fail, try again - until it works... or doesn't! After all, taking the shot is what truly counts. ¢  January may already be in full swing, but it’s never too late for a year-end recap. 2024 was an eventful year at HyPrSpace - we took on many challenges, and, to our delight, had a lot of successes along the way. We've captured for you some of the main key numbers and milestones.  None of this would have been possible without the crazy - growing - team behind all these successes. You rock space bakers, our world-class team.  Now let's face 2025. We still have a lot to accomplish; amongst many others the Critical Design Review of Baguette One, the launch of our Serie A and the static fire test campaign of our flight engine Toaster... The countdown to first flight is ticking for the first "turbopumpless” hybrid rocket!  ‘We never say it enough so thank you to everyone by our side on this challenging adventure: partners, supports, followers... And again: we wish you a very happy new  year! WY HyPrspace + Follow FEMGES 17,237 followers 6mo + Edited» ©  POV: you're an engineer at HyPrSpace.  Here, you don't stay behind your desk working on a project that you will probably not see at all. You actually get to take a comfy nap inside the engine you just designed.  As Terminator is being reassembled to conduct a second hotfire test campaign, our avionic and test engineers are (hard)working to install the 80+ sensors. They are used. collect a lot of data like temperature, pressure or even vibrations. All these precious informations are then exploited by our propulsion specialists to mesure the performances and compare it to the CFD models they created,  PS; they are not actually sleeping, last pic is fake. To be honest. it feels a bit like a space mission when you're inside it's belly. Who could fall asleep in such conditions? ©  #GoBaguetteOne #Innovation #Space

HyPrSpace + Follow 17237  7mo+@ Flashback on #NextSpace2024! @  A few days ago, we attended a symposium organised by the amazing Way4Space. Next Space 2024 was about going back to the moon, a subject that can't be  approached without talking about launchers.  And that we know... One day maybe, our patented hybrid propulsion system will fly a payload to the moon! But before that, we need to prove the world that we can make it fly to orbit.  Terminator, the big engine you see below, was a huge step towards this goal. And it  *  successfully breathed fire this summé  Our engineers were really proud to present it to our guests during the “startup tour” organised within the Next Space event.  And from the faces that came out of this visit, we're pretty sure to have convinced this lot already... Sylvain, Tiphaine, Arnaud, Loic, you guys nailed it, Just a few billions left  now!

Je suis ravi de vous partager cette excellente nouvelle : en un peu moins de deux mois, nous avons passé avec succas les deux revues de définition préliminaire (PDR) de nos projets #PADA1 et #R2D2, nous ouvrant la voie vers la phase critique de définition. ag YP Pace reposted this  Alexandre Mangeot - 3:<+ + Follow  Cofounder, CEO, CTO at HyPrSpace amo-®  Merci a La Tribune pour leur invitation au Space Forum 2024 ce mardi, oi j'ai pu  débattre avec Stanislas Maximin de Latitude et Antoine Fourcade de Sirius Space Services.  La table ronde, disponible en replay sur YouTube (lien en commentaire), portait sur le sujet : "Mini lanceurs, maxi ambitions : qui va gagner la bataille des lanceurs ?”  Au-dela d’étre un sujet 4 débats passionnants - ceux qui me suivent savent sGrement ‘déja mon amour pour la question - c'est surtout un enjeu majeur pour la France et Europe.  Dans cette course effrénée vers I'Espace, la quasi-totalité des concurrents se battent 8 armes égales en utilisant une technologie certes maitrisée, mais fortement cofteuse & développer et produire, 8 tel point qu’aucun n’a réussi a en faire un business rentable & ce jour.  Chez HyPrSpace, nous sommes partis de ce constat et avons décidé d'emprunter une autre voie : la propulsion hybride. Depuis plus de 50 ans elle souffre de verrous technologiques, pourtant cette technologie offre un potentiel incroyable de réduction des cotits, d'amélioration de l'empreinte environnementale et de la versatilité d'usage. Avec notre innovation brevetée, la propulsion hybride est aujourd'hui a portée de main s nous avons cet été réalisé 3 essais de notre moteur pleine échelle en configuration étage qui nous ont permis de valider nos modéles de performance ! Like © Comment Repost J Send  HyPrSpace  eR ke  If you are still not in holidays, here are some news about our full-scale engine in stage configuration to cheer you up!  In 2 weeks at we were able to conduct 3 tests, and to validate:  © The performance models of our innovative engine configuration © Re-ignition capabilities (as you can see, it re-ignites quite well) @ Thrust modulation capabilities  Pretty mach diamonds  With Terminator, we are breaking through the technological barrier of hybrid propulsion bringing it from the dark side to the light side  17 comments - 43 reposts  Like © Comment Repost J Send

Like © Comment Repost J Send  WY HyPrspace + Follow EES 17,237 followers 10mo + Edited + ©  3, 2, 1... Ignition sequence time. Or as Clément said it with a sexy, but shaky voice: “Allumage moteur’.  Last Thursday we fired Terminator, our stage demonstrator for the very first time, but it is - much more - than just an ignition, it's a first in the world!  This test validates HyPrSpace patented hybrid technology at full scale for space applications, The combustion and fluids performance model, the capacity to operate at a full stage scale experimentally confirming the reliability and scalability of our technology. This is a major technological demonstration for the development of  our #0B1 launcher, and opens new perspectives for space and defense applications, due to the simplicity and economical advantage of our engine.  The rest of the testing campaign will allow a full exploration of the operating range of the technology. Which means more flames to come soon!  aA To every single person that trusted us, supported us, followed us on LinkedIn since the earliest days: thank you for being behind us, you're a real source of motivation.  Also, a huge thank you to DGA - Direction générale de I'armement, and more particularly to the #DGAEssaisdemissiles Gironde site and Agence de l'innovation de défense, their team is awesome to work with, compliant and comprehensive, Also, many thanks to our partner SpaceDreams for their expertise and support !  To. Every. Single. Member of the exceptional team that made this a reality: hands down. You've all done an incredible work. You guys are talented geniuses, beautiful smiling souls, as can testify this video. Much much love to you all. @  #godspeed

BOM HyPrspace + Follow ESS 7237  ited ©  So proud of you Clément Arrat! @ &  Our (now former) Test Director temporarily left the HyPrSpace adventure for 1 year to fulfill a childhood dream that is fairly close to space in some ways: becoming an Antartica adventurer at the Franco-Italian base camp “Concordia’.  There, he will be a glaciochemist, collecting and analyzing snow samples and atmospheric sensors in extreme conditions (it can go down to minus 80 degrees celcius!). What a thrilling journey... All the team wishes you the best for this extraodinary experience!  Come back to us with the eyes full of stars, we can't wait to hear your freezing tale! ®  Glaciochimiste DC21 Sta Tmo + Edited  a Clément Arrat - 3rd+ + Follow  4 Nouvelle aventure en vue !  Je suis ravi de pouvoir enfin vous annoncer une nouvelle qui me tient particuliérement 4 coeur : 8 la fin du mois d'octobre, je m’envole pour la station Franco-Italienne Concordia, en Antarctique, pour un séjour d'un peu plus d'un an en tant que glaciochimiste.  Ce projet représente I'accomplissement d'un réve que j'ai depuis plusieurs années. Sur place, je serais chargé de mener des programmes qui comprendront notamment : prélévements de neige, relevé de capteurs atmosphériques et analyses d’échantillons. S Un grand merci a Institut polaire francais Paul-Emile Victor, IGE, Laboratoire des Sciences du Climat et de l'Environnement et au Laboratoire de météorologie dynamique pour leur confiance. Je suis impatient de commencer ce travail et de pouvoir apporter ma contribution & ces programmes de recherche  Je partagerai réguligrement mon expérience, donc n’hésitez pas & me suivre sur Instagram @clem_antarctique pour en savoir plus sur la vie et les sciences dans cet endroit un peu particulier. 3°  ea ESA  Show translation

HyPrSpace + Follow 17.237 followers  2mo+®  Winning an engineering award... with a Baguette?  We're proud to share that HyPrSpace just won the Grand Prix Arts et Métiers des Industries Responsables, attributed by the FONDATION ARTS ET  METIERS with Bpifrance. This award recognizes our startup for its technical excellence, innovation, and contribution to reindustrializing the country.  Our story started a few years ago: after completing his PhD on hybrid propulsion (we'll keep it simple), our founder Alexandre Mangeot launched HyPrSpace in 2019,  Fast forward 6 years:  70+ employees  100+ ME secured in contracts & funding  2 full-scale test campaigns on a 10-ton engine  And here we are, named the best startup founded by a Gadz’Arts graduate (short for being an engineer from the Arts & Métiers)  Thank you! @  #NewSpace #Innovation #GadzArts

PS =  CEO 283 13 comments - 4 reposts  Like © Comment Repost J Send  HyPrSpace GA 17.237 followers 3mo + Edited» ©  Launchpad news. 9  After 2 successful test campaigns on Terminator, we're glad to share that we will be continuing our partnership with and their NuPad, for the launch of our first baguettes (rockets for the rookies)!  This strong partnership goes beyond collaboration - it's an industrial symbiosis that, enables us to successfully develop both SpaceDreams’ NuPad, a multi-launcher and multisite mobile launchpad, and our Orbital Baguette One launcher.  Both our launcher Orbital Baguette One and the NuPad are a real game changer in flexibility and reactivity, which make this partnership a strong alliance for Europe's sovereignty.

S Like © Comment @ Repost 4 Send   —  AD Clément Arrat. 3:3- + Follow 8mo + Edited» @  edt  Ce n’est qu'un au revoir!  Aujourd’hui, je quitte pour une longue période I'aventure HyPrSpace, pour en rejoindre une autre dont je vous parlerai en détail d'ici peu.  Ces quelques années passées au sein de la “space bakery” m’ont tellement appris, sur moi, sur mon métier et sur les autres. Les autres, ce sont les collégues et amis, Des rencontres magnifiques que je n‘oublierai jamais.  Un immense merci a tous ; Alexandre Mangeot, Syivain Bataillard et Vincent Rocher pour m’avoir donné cette incroyable opportunité, merci a la team essais, la team Terminator et tant d'autres personnes avec qui j'ai adoré travailler. Merci pour votre confiance, votre bienveillance et vos étoiles dans les yeux pour qu'on essaye,  ensemble, daller les voir de plus pré  C'est avec un énorme pincement au cceur que je vous quite, mais également une grande fierté d’avoir participé & cette fabuleuse aventure !  Car il s'en est passé des choses, en seulement 3 ans... J'espére que ces quelques photos en témoigneront !  #GoBaguetteOne  Show translation

® Like © Comment 1% Repost J Send  MY HyPrspace + Follow BEES 17.237 followers Amo» ©  Our Trajectory - GNC engineer is named LEO.  And there's no better way to introduce one of the pillars of HyPrSpace. @ ..more  7. comments - 1 repost  Like © Comment Repost J Send   [CONTINUED_FROM_SCROLL]  WAY HyPrspace + Follow BRGY 17,237 followers Amo+® Our Trajectory - GNC engineer is named LEO.  And there's no better way to introduce one of the pillars of HyPrSpace. ©  Joining as an intern in 2021 during the company’s earliest days, Léo has been one of our most trustworthy and dedicated employees. Passionate about space mechanics, he participated in developing our in-house 3-DOF simulator. Currently, he’s focused on GNC. specifically modeling the TVC in our 6-DOF trajectory model.  It has been a while since we posted about one of our space bakers. &  So as we just wrapped up our third HyPrSki weekend, we wanted to dedicate a post to one of the organizers.  Because Léo isn't "just" a trajectory crack. Like © Comment Repost J Send  WY HyPrspace + Follow BESS 17,237 followers 6mo + Edited» ©  & Terminator assembly update &  Crucial step of our stage demonstrator assembly: putting the small one into the big one.  Not the usual assembly process right? @  That's because our engine has a unique architectu inside the other, with the combustion chamber situated in between.  is made of 2 cylinders one  The gap of the combustion chamber ensured by this design allows us to use hybrid propulsion at its maximum performances during the full duration of the flight, without suffering of combustion inefficiencies due to fuel blocks regression.  Also, the hot flow is in contact with twice the wet surface as a classic engine, making it even more efficient.  If you find this innovation as amazing as we do, you really should follow the rest of the fire test campaign. Some huge flames are coming. @ @  #engineering #innovation #newspace
